message.content:
{"id": "108822", 
"title": "More efficient disk sorting logic needed when there is a border value for row value", 
"description": "", 
"OB": "When sorting on disk, if sorting on 40,000 rows of data, and the program is set to process less than 40,000 rows, the following operations are performed by DtE: 1. ", 
"EB": "When sorting on disk, if sorting on 40,000 rows of data, and the program is set to process less than 40,000 rows, the expected behavior should be: 1. Save the data as a temporary file. 2. Load the data from the file into memory. 3. Perform the sorting operation on the data. 4. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file.", 
"SR": "To address this issue, the logic for disk sorting needs to be improved to handle cases where there is a border value for the row value. The expected behavior should be: 1. Save the data as a temporary file. 2. Load the data from the file into memory. 3. Perform the sorting operation on the data. 4. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
